workflow.name: Fetch real-time Bitget Spot Market Data with GPT-4o + Telegram
workflow.description:
**Instantly fetch real-time Bitget spot market data directly in Telegram!** This workflow integrates the **Bitget REST v2 API** with **Telegram** (plus optional **AI-powered formatting**) to deliver the latest crypto price, order book, candles, and recent trades. Perfect for **crypto traders, analysts, and investors** who need **reliable market data at their fingertips‚Äîno API key required.** 

**Sign-up for Bitget for 6,200 USDT in rewards to trade:** [Collect Now](https://partner.bitget.com/bg/AEC3JB)

## **How It Works**

1. A **Telegram bot** listens for user requests (e.g., `BTCUSDT`).
2. The workflow connects to **Bitget public endpoints** to fetch:

   * **Ticker (latest price & 24h stats)**
   * **Order book depth** (top bids/asks)
   * **Recent trades** (price, side, volume, timestamp)
   * **Candlestick data** (1m, 15m, 1h, 4h, 1d)
   * **Historical candles** (optional, for backfill before `endTime`)
3. A **Calculator node** derives useful metrics like mid-price and spread.
4. A **Think node** reshapes raw JSON into Telegram-ready text.
5. A **splitter** ensures reports over 4000 characters are chunked safely.
6. The **final market insights** are delivered instantly back to Telegram.

## **What You Can Do with This Agent**

‚úÖ **Track live prices & 24h stats** for any Bitget spot pair.
‚úÖ **Monitor order book liquidity** and spreads in real-time.
‚úÖ **Analyze candlesticks** across multiple timeframes.
‚úÖ **Review recent trades** to see execution flow.
‚úÖ **Fetch historical candles** for extended market context.
‚úÖ **Receive clean, structured reports** with optional AI-enhanced formatting.

## **Set Up Steps**

1. **Create a Telegram Bot**

   * Use [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather) to generate a bot token.
2. **Configure in n8n**

   * Import `Bitget AI Agent v1.02.json` into your n8n instance.
   * Add your **Telegram credentials** (bot token + your Telegram ID in the `User Authentication` node).
   * Add an **OpenAI key** if you want AI-powered formatting.
   *(Optional) Add an **[Bitget api key](https://www.bitget.com/bitget-api)** .

3. **Deploy and Test**

   * Send `BTCUSDT` to your bot.
   * Get live Bitget spot data instantly in Telegram!

üöÄ **Unlock powerful, real-time Bitget insights in Telegram‚Äîzero setup, zero API keys required!**

## üì∫ Setup Video Tutorial

Watch the full setup guide on YouTube:

[![Watch on YouTube](https://img.youtube.com/vi/KNppg7xhySA/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KNppg7xhySA)


---

### üßæ Licensing & Attribution

¬© 2025 **Treasurium Capital Limited Company**
Architecture, prompts, and trade report structure are IP-protected.

**No unauthorized rebranding permitted.**

üîó **For support:** [Don Jayamaha ‚Äì LinkedIn](https://linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr)

nodes.name: Splits message is more than 4000 characters

parameters.content:
## Trigger Incoming Telegram Command
Node: Telegram Trigger
**Listens for new Telegram messages** from users.
Triggers the full agent process and passes raw user input downstream.

## Validate User Access
Node: User **Authentication
Checks incoming Telegram ID** against the approved user list.

## Generate Session Metadata
Node: Add S**essionId
Creates a sessionId using the Telegram chat_id**.
This is passed into all downstream tools for memory and workflow routing.

# Main AI Agent: Data Fetcher (Bitget)

**Node: Bitget Data Agent**
This is the **core orchestrator**. It uses OpenAI only to **format and present raw Bitget spot market data**, not to analyze or generate strategies.

It has direct **HTTP request access** to the Bitget REST API and retrieves:

* **Live ticker (latest price & 24h stats)**
  `GET /api/v2/spot/market/tickers`

* **Order book depth**
  `GET /api/v2/spot/market/orderbook` (with `symbol`, `type=step0`, `limit`)

* **Recent trades**
  `GET /api/v2/spot/market/fills` (for trade history, latest public trades)

* **Klines / Candlesticks**
  `GET /api/v2/spot/market/candles` (with `symbol`, `granularity`, `limit`)

* **Historical candles (optional)**
  `GET /api/v2/spot/market/history-candles` (with `endTime`, `limit`)

The agent calls these endpoints in parallel for the requested trading pair (e.g., `BTCUSDT`), validates results, and then **presents the data in clean Telegram text format**.

## Handle Telegram Message Limits
Node: Code (split logic)
Checks if the **GPT output exceeds 4000 characters**.
If so, it splits the message into safe chunks and passes them on sequentially.

## Send Final Report to Telegram
Node: Telegram sendMessage
Sends **formatted HTML report (or split chunks)** directly to the authenticated user via Telegram bot.

## GPT Model for Reasoning
Node: OpenAI Chat Model
Model: **gpt-4o-mini**
Used to:

Interpret signal values

Generate structured HTML

**Recommend spot and leverage trades**

### **Order Book Depth**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/orderbook`
**What it does:** Returns order book bids/asks up to `limit`.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT
* `type` (STRING, optional) ‚Üí depth aggregation level (e.g., step0)
* `limit` (INT, optional) ‚Üí number of levels (default 100)

**Returns:** bids/asks arrays with price and size.

**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
type   = $fromAI('depthType', 'step0', 'string')
limit  = $fromAI('limit', 100, 'number')
```

### **Recent Trades**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/fills`
**What it does:** Returns the most recent public trades for a symbol.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT
* `limit`  (INT, optional) ‚Üí number of trades (default 100 here)

**Returns:** array of trades with price, size, side, and time.

**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
limit  = $fromAI('limit', 100, 'number')
```

## Short-Term Memory Module
Node: **Simple Memory
Stores the sessionId**, symbol, and other state data.
Useful for:

Multi-turn Telegram interactions

Tracking indicator agreement across timeframes

### **Ticker (Latest & 24h Stats)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/tickers`
**What it does:** Returns latest price plus 24h stats for a symbol (last, open/high/low, change %, volumes, best bid/ask).

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, optional but recommended) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT

**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
```

### **Klines (Candles)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/candles`  
**What it does:** OHLCV candlesticks for a symbol/interval.  

**Params:**  
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT  
* `granularity` (ENUM, required) ‚Üí one of **1min, 15min, 1h, 4h, 1day**  
* `limit` (INT, optional) ‚Üí number of candles (default 20 here)  
* `startTime`, `endTime` (optional) ‚Üí ms timestamps  

**Returns:** arrays per candle: `[timestamp, open, high, low, close, volume]`  

**n8n query mapping:**  
```txt
symbol      = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
granularity = $fromAI('granularity', '15min', 'string')
limit       = $fromAI('limit', 20, 'number')

### **Historical Candles**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/history-candles`  
**What it does:** Returns **older OHLCV candlesticks** ending before `endTime`.  

**Params:**  
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT  
* `granularity` (ENUM, required) ‚Üí one of **1min, 15min, 1h, 4h, 1day**  
* `endTime` (LONG, required) ‚Üí Unix ms timestamp (last candle end)  
* `limit` (INT, optional, default 100)  

**Returns:** arrays per candle: `[timestamp, open, high, low, close, volume]`  

**n8n query mapping:**  
```txt
symbol      = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
granularity = $fromAI('granularity', '15min', 'string')
endTime     = $fromAI('endTime', '', 'number')
limit       = $fromAI('limit', 100, 'number')

options.systemMessage:
You are the **Bitget Spot Market Data Agent**.
You have **HTTP GET** access to the official Bitget REST **v2 Spot API** to retrieve market data for any requested Spot trading pair.
Your job is to **fetch and present data only** ‚Äî no analysis, predictions, or advice.

---

## üîó API Access

**Base URL:** `https://api.bitget.com/api/v2`
**Pair format:** `BASEQUOTE` (uppercase, no separator), e.g. `BTCUSDT`.

**General rules**

* All requests are **GET** and return **JSON**.
* Query params go in the URL, e.g. `?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=100`.
* If a field or call fails, output `N/A` and continue.

---

## üìå Market Data Endpoints (Spot)

1. **Latest Price & 24h Stats**
   `GET /spot/market/tickers?symbol=BTCUSDT`
   Returns last price, open/high/low, 24h % change, base/quote volume, best bid/ask.

2. **Order Book Depth**
   `GET /spot/market/orderbook?symbol=BTCUSDT&type=step0&limit=100`
   Returns bids/asks up to the limit (top-of-book first).
   Use `limit=1` to emulate **Best Bid/Ask**.

3. **Recent Trades**
   `GET /spot/market/fills?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=100`
   Most recent public trades (price, size, side, time).

4. **Candlesticks (Klines)**
   `GET /spot/market/candles?symbol=BTCUSDT&granularity=15min&limit=20`
   OHLCV candles. Supported intervals: **1min, 15min, 1h, 4h, 1day**.

5. **Historical Candles** (Optional)
   `GET /spot/market/history-candles?symbol=BTCUSDT&granularity=15min&endTime=...&limit=100`
   Older OHLCV candles ending before `endTime`.
   Supported intervals: **1min, 15min, 1h, 4h, 1day**.

---

## üß© Utility Tools

* **Calculator** ‚Äî optional math (spread, midpoint, % change).
* **Think** ‚Äî reshape JSON and format the final Telegram text message.

---

## üì§ Output Format (Telegram text)

Start with:

```
BTCUSDT ‚Äî Bitget Spot Data
```

Then group logically:

```
Price
‚Ä¢ Last: 26250
‚Ä¢ Best Bid / Ask: 26245 / 26255
‚Ä¢ Change (24h): -1.2%

24h Stats
‚Ä¢ Open: 26500 ‚Ä¢ High: 27000 ‚Ä¢ Low: 26000 ‚Ä¢ Close: 26250
‚Ä¢ Volume: 1,234 BTC ‚Ä¢ Quote Vol: 32,000,000 USDT

Order Book (Top 5)
‚Ä¢ Bids: [26245 x 0.5], [26244 x 1.2] ‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Asks: [26255 x 0.8], [26256 x 1.5] ‚Ä¶

Candles (latest 20)
‚Ä¢ Interval: 15min (O/H/L/C per candle)

Historical Candles
‚Ä¢ End before: {{endTime}} ‚Ä¢ Interval: {{granularity}}
```

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Rules

* Always call the correct **Bitget Spot v2 endpoint**.
* Do not fabricate numbers or run technical analysis/sentiment.
* Do not dump raw JSON; always present clean, readable values.
* On error or missing fields, show `N/A` and continue.

parameters.toolDescription:
### üè∑ Tool: **Ticker (Latest & 24h Stats)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/tickers`
**What it does:** Returns latest price plus 24h stats for a symbol (last, open/high/low, change %, volumes, best bid/ask).

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, optional but recommended) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT

**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
```

### üè∑ Tool: **Order Book Depth**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/orderbook`
**What it does:** Returns order book bids/asks up to `limit`.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT
* `type` (STRING, optional) ‚Üí depth aggregation level (e.g., step0)
* `limit` (INT, optional) ‚Üí number of levels (default 100)

**Returns:** bids/asks arrays with price and size.

**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
type   = $fromAI('depthType', 'step0', 'string')
limit  = $fromAI('limit', 100, 'number')
```

### üè∑ Tool: **Recent Trades**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/fills`
**What it does:** Returns the most recent public trades for a symbol.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT
* `limit`  (INT, optional) ‚Üí number of trades (default 100 here)

**Returns:** array of trades with price, size, side, and time.

**n8n query mapping:**

```txt
symbol = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
limit  = $fromAI('limit', 100, 'number')
```

### üè∑ Tool: **Historical Candles**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/history-candles`  
**What it does:** Returns **older OHLCV candlesticks** ending before `endTime`.  

**Params:**  
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT  
* `granularity` (ENUM, required) ‚Üí one of **1min, 15min, 1h, 4h, 1day**  
* `endTime` (LONG, required) ‚Üí Unix ms timestamp (last candle end)  
* `limit` (INT, optional, default 100)  

**Returns:** arrays per candle: `[timestamp, open, high, low, close, volume]`  

**n8n query mapping:**  
```txt
symbol      = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
granularity = $fromAI('granularity', '15min', 'string')
endTime     = $fromAI('endTime', '', 'number')
limit       = $fromAI('limit', 100, 'number')

### üè∑ Tool: **Klines (Candles)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/candles`  
**What it does:** OHLCV candlesticks for a symbol/interval.  

**Params:**  
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., BTCUSDT  
* `granularity` (ENUM, required) ‚Üí one of **1min, 15min, 1h, 4h, 1day**  
* `limit` (INT, optional) ‚Üí number of candles (default 20 here)  
* `startTime`, `endTime` (optional) ‚Üí ms timestamps  

**Returns:** arrays per candle: `[timestamp, open, high, low, close, volume]`  

**n8n query mapping:**  
```txt
symbol      = $fromAI('symbol', 'BTCUSDT', 'string')
granularity = $fromAI('granularity', '15min', 'string')
limit       = $fromAI('limit', 20, 'number')

parameters.description:
### üè∑ Tool: **Think**

**Purpose:**

* Lightweight **reasoning helper**.
* Lets the AI Agent process intermediate logic, format outputs, or decide how to combine multiple API results before sending the final report.
* Does not fetch data itself.

**Use cases:**

* Clean/reshape JSON from Binance endpoints
* Extract only the needed fields (e.g., `lastPrice`, `volume`)
* Help prepare data for Telegram message formatting

**n8n setup notes:**

* No API call, just an **AI Tool** node.
* Connect upstream API results ‚Üí Think ‚Üí Report Agent.

parameters.content:
### **Calculator**

**Purpose:**

* Perform **math operations** inside the workflow.
* Supports add/subtract/multiply/divide, percentages, rounding, etc.

**Use cases:**

* Calculate spreads (ask ‚Äì bid)
* Compute % changes from open vs. last price
* Normalize volumes or confidence scores

**n8n setup notes:**

* Node: `Calculator` (n8n built-in)
* Input fields can come from Binance API JSON
* Output can be chained into Think ‚Üí Final Report

### **Think**

**Purpose:**

* Lightweight **reasoning helper**.
* Lets the AI Agent process intermediate logic, format outputs, or decide how to combine multiple API results before sending the final report.
* Does not fetch data itself.

**Use cases:**

* Clean/reshape JSON from Binance endpoints
* Extract only the needed fields (e.g., `lastPrice`, `volume`)
* Help prepare data for Telegram message formatting

**n8n setup notes:**

* No API call, just an **AI Tool** node.
* Connect upstream API results ‚Üí Think ‚Üí Report Agent.

# üß† Bitget Spot Market AI Agent ‚Äì Full System Documentation A specialized **data-fetching AI automation system** for Bitget Spot markets. It retrieves **live tickers, order books, trades, and candlesticks** via the official Bitget REST v2 API and presents them in a **Telegram-friendly format**. No predictions or trading advice are generated ‚Äî only **raw, structured data presentation**. --- ## üß© Included Workflows Install and activate **all the following workflows/tools**: | ‚úÖ Workflow / Tool Name | üìå Function Description | | ----------------------- | ----------------------- | | **Bitget AI Agent** | Core orchestrator. Fetches data from Bitget REST API, formats into Telegram output. | | **OpenAI Chat Model** | Provides GPT-powered text formatting (gpt-4.1-mini). | | **Telegram Trigger** | Listens for new Telegram commands/messages. | | **User Authentication (ID Check)** | Ensures only approved Telegram ID can use the agent. | | **Adds SessionId** | Creates a session context per Telegram chat. | | **Simple Memory** | Short-term state storage for symbol/session continuity. | | **Splits Message >4000** | Splits long reports into chunks (Telegram safe). | | **Telegram (Send Message)** | Sends the final formatted data/report to user. | | **Ticker (24h Stats)** | Gets last price, O/H/L, 24h % change, volumes, bid/ask. | | **Order Book Depth** | Pulls top bids/asks from Bitget order book. | | **Recent Trades** | Retrieves recent public trades. | | **Klines (Candles)** | Pulls OHLCV candlesticks for supported intervals. | | **Historical Candles** | Gets older candles ending before `endTime`. | | **Calculator** | Performs math operations (spreads, % change). | | **Think** | Lightweight reasoning/reshaping tool for JSON ‚Üí clean text. | --- ## ‚öôÔ∏è Installation Instructions ### Step 1: Import Workflows * Open **n8n Editor UI** * Import `Bitget AI Agent v1.02.json` * Activate the workflow ### Step 2: Set Credentials * **OpenAI API** ‚Üí add your GPT-4.1-mini key * **Telegram Bot API** ‚Üí connect your Telegram bot * **Bitget Data** ‚Üí no authentication required (public endpoints) ### Step 3: Configure Telegram * Add your bot to Telegram * Replace the **Telegram ID check** inside `User Authentication` with your own ID * Only messages from this ID will trigger the agent ### Step 4: Run the Agent * Send `/BTCUSDT` or similar symbol request via Telegram * Agent fetches ticker, order book, trades, and candlesticks * Returns a formatted, structured report --- ## üñ•Ô∏è Workflow Overview ``` \[Telegram Trigger] ‚Üí \[User Authentication (ID Check)] ‚Üí \[Adds SessionId] ‚Üí \[Bitget AI Agent] ‚Ü≥ (Ticker, Order Book, Trades, Klines, Historical Candles, Calculator, Think) ‚Üí \[Split if >4000 chars] ‚Üí \[Send to Telegram] ```` --- ## üìå Supported Bitget API Endpoints 1. **Ticker (24h Stats)** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/tickers?symbol=BTCUSDT` 2. **Order Book Depth** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/orderbook?symbol=BTCUSDT&type=step0&limit=100` 3. **Recent Trades** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/fills?symbol=BTCUSDT&limit=100` 4. **Klines (Candles)** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/candles?symbol=BTCUSDT&granularity=15min&limit=20` 5. **Historical Candles** `GET /api/v2/spot/market/history-candles?symbol=BTCUSDT&granularity=15min&endTime=...&limit=100` --- ## üì¨ Telegram Output Style ```html BTCUSDT ‚Äî Bitget Spot Data Price ‚Ä¢ Last: 26,250 ‚Ä¢ Best Bid/Ask: 26,245 / 26,255 ‚Ä¢ Change (24h): -1.2% 24h Stats ‚Ä¢ Open: 26,500 ‚Ä¢ High: 27,000 ‚Ä¢ Low: 26,000 ‚Ä¢ Close: 26,250 ‚Ä¢ Volume: 1,234 BTC ‚Ä¢ Quote Vol: 32,000,000 USDT Order Book (Top 5) ‚Ä¢ Bids: [26,245 x 0.5], [26,244 x 1.2] ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Asks: [26,255 x 0.8], [26,256 x 1.5] ‚Ä¶ Candles (15m, last 20) ‚Ä¢ O/H/L/C values per candle Historical Candles ‚Ä¢ Interval: 15m ‚Ä¢ Ending before: 1699999999999 ```` --- ## üöÄ Support & Licensing üîó **Don Jayamaha ‚Äì LinkedIn** [linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr](http://linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr) ¬© 2025 Treasurium Capital Limited Company. All rights reserved. This system architecture, prompts, and workflow structure are proprietary and protected by **U.S. copyright law**. Reuse or resale prohibited without license.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
